intro: Pedicularis paddoensis, commonly known as the Paddock's lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of New Zealand. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its upright stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple. It typically grows in rocky or open habitats at high elevations. Due to its limited distribution and specialized habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
